page.title: 10LANGUAGE IN AYLESBURY
page.content: The population of Aylesbury contains a diversity of peoples who originate from many different countries.These people have brought with them a variety of languages and cultures which add greatly to the community. Some examples of European languages spoken in addition to English are: French,Spanish,Italian and Polish. Whilst the Asian community in Aylesbury speak Hindi, Punjabi, Urdu, Gujrati, Bangali, Afgani, Farsi, Pashto and Arabic. Many of these families would speak their native language as their first language, with English being spoken outside the home, often being learnt by children in school. There is a Language Centre in Dunsham Lane where English is taught to school age children who come to the country with no spoken English.
